A.expectations_vs_outcome: quite surprising - much better than i thought it would be - didnt have th urge to turn it off after 15seconds, the connection between the audio and visuals isnt in my head - i had no idea how it was going to turn out but still quite please with how turned out
A.interference_notes: I was quite suprised in how the sound/visual/speed fitted together, as I has no idea how it would sound when I was making it

B.expectations_vs_outcome: No idea! On viewing, I felt the visuals were a bit sparse, but the sound was spacious
B.interference_notes: I found the audio more interesting/coherent than the visuals

C.expectations_vs_outcome: not particularly - at the beginning i thought it was a bit boring but when it got into the different notes and the speed i did rather like it - don't think i could reproduce it ever as its not in my head, not surre sure that i could identify it from a bunch of the other. i wanted to be able to get the ending to resonate and tail off more
C.interference_notes: not really - would need to play it more, it might do,

one_change: No idea! But overall, it went better than I thought it would - I had no idea what to expect...
reflection: It helps if you can hear the audio in your head while usinf the system.  I felt more in control when using both at the same time, but was pleased and a bit surprised with the result of the audio only piece
session_notes_transcription: i dont hear the melodies in my head so dont consider myself a musician, but have experience playing; speak to each other (lights); im obsessed with getting the lights (to group) together; not working; need more wooo; becuase i cant hear the association in my head;at the moment feeling neutral about it;i didnt know how it was going to sound; visuals were a bit sparse but the sound was spacious (conflict between what makes visuals good versus audio good);
